column1: Conscious sedation is a combination of medicines to help you relax (a sedative) and to block pain (an anesthetic) during a medical or dental procedure.
A nurse, doctor, or dentist, will give you conscious sedation in the hospital or outpatient clinic.
Conscious sedation is safe and effective for people who need minor surgery or a procedure to diagnose a condition.
During recovery, your finger will be clipped to a special device (pulse oximeter) to check the oxygen levels in your blood.
